name: Katsutaro Kouta
description: {{nihongo|'''Katsutaro Kouta'''|小唄 勝太郎|Kouta Katsutarō|extra=November 6, 1904 – June 21, 1974}} was a Japanese female [[geisha]] and {{lang|ja-Latn|[[ryūkōka]]}} singer, who performed in the "New-{{lang|ja-Latn|[[Min'yō]]}}" style of singing. {{lang|ja-Latn|Kouta|italic=no}} came to be most well known, alongside another popular geisha singer, {{lang|ja-Latn|[[Ichimaru]]|italic=no}}, in the "{{lang|ja-Latn|Katsu-Ichi|italic=no}} Era".
